modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Inability' of the human subject and the 'Super-ability' (Pouvoir) of God. It is a theology of empowerment through grace.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the failure of logic (~S1) to the overwhelming weight of S2 (Sin/Finitude), finally resolved by the Spirit moving the hearer to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved not by human understanding, but by the 'Presence' of the Spirit which bypasses the 'Gateway' of the mind.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; sin and finitude are presented as absolute barriers to the Object.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly rejects human effort (logic, oratory, scholarship) as the means of grace, positioning God as the sole effective Subject.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: he who has begun in us a good work will perform it
I'm rooted in sin! ... your mind will never grasp this

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Augustine and Paul are mentioned not as moral examples to follow, but as fellow-sufferers of the gospel's magnitude.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God works through the weakness of Augustine just as He works through the preacher.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of 'understanding' or 'achieving' is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic revelation; God must act for the hearer to receive.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon's structure perfectly mirrors its content: the preacher's failure (narrative) points to God's power (theology).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: rooted and grounded in love... that Christ may dwell in your hearts

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir-faire' (ability) that the 'Savoir-faire' (reason) lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total inability of the mind and heart without divine intervention.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject. The preacher intentionally demotes himself to 'Helper' and elevates the Holy Spirit to 'Subject'.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the grace-orientation.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in grace-oriented narrative structure. By centering the 'inability' of the preacher and the hearer, it creates a vacuum that only the 'superabundant' action of God can fill.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis might criticize the 'frustration' as a trope; semiotics sees it as a necessary actantial move to disqualify the human Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Greek of Ephesians 3; semiotics focuses on how the 'riches' function as an unattainable Object for the human Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the preacher's 'retreat' at the end is a formal transfer of the Subject role to God (the Doxology).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'Wild Words' as a signifier for the semiotic break between human language and divine reality.
